Package com.apriori.tuples

APIs for type-safe tuples.

See: Description

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    Tuple
    Base interface implemented by all type-safe tuples.
    Tuple.Ops1<A>
    Operations supported by tuples that have at least one element.
    Tuple.Ops2<A,B>
    Operations supported by tuples that have at least two elements.
    Tuple.Ops3<A,B,C>
    Operations supported by tuples that have at least three elements.
    Tuple.Ops4<A,B,C,D>
    Operations supported by tuples that have at least four elements.
    Tuple.Ops5<A,B,C,D,E>
    Operations supported by tuples that have at least five elements.
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    Empty
    A tuple that has no elements.
    NTuple<A,B,C,D,E>
    A tuple that has more than five elements.
    Pair<A,B>
    A tuple with two items.
    Quartet<A,B,C,D>
    A tuple with four items.
    Quintet<A,B,C,D,E>
    A tuple with five items.
    Trio<A,B,C>
    A tuple with three items.
    Tuples
    Utility methods for creating and using Tuple instances.
    Unit<A>
    A tuple with a single item.

Package com.apriori.tuples Description

APIs for type-safe tuples. Pair is a commonly needed tuple, for combining two objects or for returning two values from a function. A typical way to handle this need in Java is to create a new class that contains the two (or more values). But tuples are a more generic and functional way of combining objects.

This package includes typesafe APIs for tuples with up to 5 elements. It does support tuples with greater than 5 elements, but items after the fifth receive no special API and thus are not typesafe (e.g. require downcasting from Object).
